title: Enhancing Conversational Agents with Theory of Mind: Aligning Beliefs, Desires, and Intentions for Human-Like Interaction
author: Mohammadmahdi Jafari (UNSW Sydney), Devin Yuncheng Hua (UNSW Sydney), Dr. Hao Xue (UNSW Sydney), Prof. Flora Salim (UNSW Sydney), ..., Flora Salim (UNSW Sydney)
relevance_why: The research on enhancing conversational agents with Theory of Mind (ToM) has potential applications in AI-driven audio and speech systems where understanding user intent and context is crucial for generating appropriate audio responses.
background: This paper investigates how implementing Theory of Mind in Conversational Agents can improve their interactions with humans by better understanding mental states.
contribution: This paper introduces a ToM-informed alignment strategy to enhance the performance of conversational agents, demonstrating improved response quality through explicit modeling of beliefs, desires, and intentions.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods typically lack the explicit modeling of mental states which can lead to miscommunication and less effective responses in conversational AI.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work integrates a formal framework for understanding mental states to systematically enhance conversational responses in LLMs.

key_innovation: The unique approach is the integration of ToM components into conversational agents to make interactions more human-like and contextually aware.
real_world_impact: This has immediate implications for improving user experience in various applications such as mental health support chatbots and customer service systems, leading to more empathetic and effective communication.
limitations: Some challenges exist regarding the generalizability of findings across different conversational contexts and the need for extensive dataset diversification.

new_terms.Theory of Mind: **Theory of Mind (ToM)** is the ability to attribute mental states—beliefs, desires, intentions—to oneself and others, and to understand that others may have different perspectives.

open_sourcing: For further details, refer to the code repository.
